profile_positions.description:
Member of Microbiology and Sterility Assurance Department at Lonza Netherlands 
Main functions are:
-Plan, control and execute quality tests and control activities (e.g. QC and release incoming
goods, QC of IPC and final product, QC sample and results management) including
documentation.
- Work and check progress in KPI closures( NC, change request and CAPAS implementation)
- Write and review documentation such SOP’s, Quality Instructions, protocols and reports, related to quality control activities.
- Design, research and plan method verifications for new projects 
- Suggest and improve training activities and process improvements.
- Involved in planning activities in cooperation with the Teamleader Quality Control.
- Provide guidance to Quality Control Associates.
- Responsible person for container validation and cooperation with MSAT department.
- Back up for Teamleader.
- Use  of software tools such as DMS , Tackswise , SAP, RESCOP, LIMS
-Knowledge in operation of automated microbial identification with MALDI-TOF and sterility testing with BacT Alert system.
profile_positions.title: Senior QC Associate Microbiology

profile_positions.description:
Consorcio Industrial is a cosmetic manufacturing company with approx 300 employees with main location in Arequipa- Peru. The company has three manufacturing installations, for instance soap factory, perfumes  and solids factory like gels and baby powder. The company has more than 300 different products that are shipped to countries in Latin America such as Chile, Bolivia and Colombia. 

In this position I was  Head of the Quality Department and legal representative of the company to the Ministry of Health in Peru . My main responsibilities were:
-Report deviations from the Quality System for the adoption of corrective actions according to CAPAS and NC procedures. 
- Inspect and give directives for sampling based on the sampling tables and evaluate compliance with the specifications of raw material, auxiliary material and finished product of the plant, which will decide its acceptance or rejection
- Conduct training on the procedures for the personnel in charge
-Perform the change controls corresponding to the area as required
- Develop training programs, equipment calibration, validations, etc. and enforce them to their fullness
- Give the release and approval of finished products, packaging material and raw materials to ensure the quality of these according to company standards
- Prepare technical specifications of raw material according to the certificates of analysis of the suppliers qualified by the company
- Develop suitability assays of the analytical techniques used in the company to ensure quality products
- Verify and control the filling of records and correct application of established procedures.
- Report timely the results of tests of samples analyzed to give release of both finished products and raw materials.
- Management of customer audits and regulatory compliance.
-Give the final signature in quality protocols for product´s approval and final release.
profile_positions.title: Quality Control Leader

profile_positions.description:
Main functions: 
-Perform microbiological analysis according to USP ( United States Pharmacopeia) established procedures for the determination of the presence / absence of total microorganisms, fungi, yeasts and pathogens in the entire line of production process of soaps, vaselines, creams and others; using certified ATCC strains as a positive control, following the quality management system, GMP's .
- Preparation of culture media and sterile laboratory material for microbiology analysis
- Perform control of laboratory equipment such as autoclaves and incubators.
- Periodically perform an environmental control of plants which includes, exhibition, swabbing of machinery, instruments and personnel.
- Perform microbiological control of subsoil , demineralized, purified and drinking water.
- Control of ATCC strains.

profile_positions.description:
This Medical Laboratory was a small company that worked in the Health and Services sector . The company has 5 employees working in blood test  analysis like glucose, cholesterol and cancer testing. The laboratory has two main areas: biochemical analysis more related with blood and urine test and the microbiology area where all the antibiotics resistance and urine analysis were performed.  

Main functions:

-Carrying out sample taking of patients (oncological, children and elderly) by different methods
- Perform biochemical analyzes such as glucose, cholesterol, lipid profile and others. Perform biochemical analysis in both blood and urine
- Perform urocultures and antibiograms which includes the preparation of laboratory material and culture media.
- Perform quality control tests, external controls and maintenance of reagents.
 - Perform the periodic calibration of the biochemical test equipment
- Patient orientation about their results.
